target: for information purposes, antipsychotics ( major tranquilizers ), are medications used to treat psychotic illnesses like schizophrenia, bipolar mania, aggression, and certain behavioral issues associated with alzheimer's disease. they are categorized as neuroleptics and have historically included drugs like haloperidol and chlorpromazine. recently, a newer class known as atypical antipsychotics has been developed, featuring drugs such as clozapine, olanzapine, risperidone, and quetiapine. atypical antipsychotics are favored for their reduced side effects compared to earlier medications in this class. one could refer to the wikipedia page on antipsychotics : http : / / en. wikipedia. org / wiki / antipsychotic.
